result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Vanessa M Alicea was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Vanessa M Alicea was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vanessa M Alicea in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  The court ordered defendant to serve 40 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, child care, school, and treatment.  Court stays report date to 06-29-2015 by 5pm.  
*Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 12 months.  
*Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 12 months.   
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $350.00 including costs, penalties and surcharges.  Any bail on deposit to apply. 

As to Count 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction.   Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, child care, school, and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or any illegal drugs.
*Full-time work/school/community service work, or a combination thereof. 
*Any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate by agent.  
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges.  Any bail on deposit to apply.  

As to the $350.00 fine ordered for Count 1 and the costs, fees and surcharges ordered in Count 3:  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $50 per month with the first payment due on 08-01-2015 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Vanessa M Alicea in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing. Defense requests additional time for defendant to complete treatment.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vanessa M Alicea in court.  James J Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
